    • Method Detail

      • initPlayer2

        @RequestMapping(value="/playWithFriend/{username}/{socketUrl}")
public GameModel initPlayer2(@PathVariable
                                                                                              java.lang.String username,
                                                                                              @PathVariable
                                                                                              java.lang.String socketUrl)
        This API endpoint initializes player 2. It is called when the URL generated after Player 1 is initialized is called by Player 2 in another browser. Note that this endpoint should be present in the BattleController controller class. This will be updated in future updates.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of Player 2 after the player enters it in the welcome form.
        socketUrl - The Socket-ID or unique ID from PlayerMatches model.
        Returns:
        The GameModel POJO class containing all the details about Player 2, including the ship positions.

      • processMessageFromClient

        @MessageMapping(value="/message/{id}")
 @SendTo(value="/topic/reply/{id}")
public java.lang.String processMessageFromClient(@Payload
                                                                                                                              java.lang.String message,
                                                                                                                              @DestinationVariable(value="id")
                                                                                                                              java.lang.String socketId)
                                                                                                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This is the main endpoint that handles all the WebSocket connections. It receives the Socket-Id from the URL, and the message from WebSocket payload.
        • If the message body contains start, it's an indication by Player 2 that it has initialized it's board and is ready to play. At this stage, Player 1 requests the username of Player 2 from another RESTful API endpoint.
        • If it does not contain the start message, it'll then contain the coordinate of the BattleBoard where the player attacked. Whether it was player 1, or player 2 is identified by the html coordinate-id. Once identified the other player is attacked and the based on the attack position, i.e. if it contains a ship, or if it is a blank coordinate, or if this attack resulted in a win, etc., an appropriate response is generated and sent to the client.
        Parameters:
        message - Message received from the client regarding the game proceedings.
        socketId - The unique Id from the PlayerMatches model that is used as Socket-Id for WebSockets connection.
        Returns:
        Response to the incoming message. Varies and is based on the type of message received.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - In case there are any exceptions that are not yet handled.

      • handleException

        @MessageExceptionHandler
public java.lang.String handleException(java.lang.Throwable exception)
        This endpoint sends an error message in case there is any error or exception.
        Parameters:
        exception - The Exception Message
        Returns:
        The error message
